docstring.long_description:
The description of that function is as follows:

    Compute the (Moore-Penrose) pseudo-inverse of a matrix.

    Calculate the generalized inverse of a matrix using its singular-value decomposition (SVD) and including all **large** singular values.

.. versionchanged:: 1.14
    Can now operate on stacks of matrices
docstring.short_description: The PINV node is based on a numpy or scipy function.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: Matrix or stack of matrices to be pseudo-inverted.

parameters.name: rcond
parameters.description:
Cutoff for small singular values.
Singular values less than or equal to "rcond * largest_singular_value" are set to zero.
Broadcasts against the stack of matrices.

parameters.name: hermitian
parameters.description:
If True, "a" is assumed to be Hermitian (symmetric if real-valued), enabling a more
efficient method for finding singular values.
Defaults to False.
